google_reviews.author: Eric Childs
google_reviews.review: Tullwood is not a bad place to live. It's quieter than most apts as it's away from roads and cinder block construction lessens any noise from common walls. Neighbors are friendly and helpful if you make an effort and reciprocate. Management is responsive and fair minded. It's a bargain given the square footage and amenities compared to most apartments in the area. And the security is good. Never saw the nearby homeless inside the complex. If you can live with occasional smoke from them and less than pristine hallways/stairways (all apts struggle to keep common areas clean) it is a nice place to live. Minor inconveniences given the advantage of Walmart next door.

google_reviews.author: Matt F
google_reviews.review: The apartments are spacious clean and modeled very nice. I love the fact that it's a secure building with an amazing manager, Amy. Amy who goes beyond her daily duties to make sure the tenants are well taken care of and safe. She's very strong with her job and holds the ground to keep her tenants safe. Honest and reliable. She Works very well in a timely matter to address any problems that may arise. For the price and how nice these apartments are and the wonderful people who live there I would recommend.

google_reviews.author: Renelle Leinbach
google_reviews.review: Dan is amazing!  My daughter recently moved there and I'm in another state.  He has been so helpful. (carrying up large packages,  watching out for my daughter, answering my questions quickly and helping us resolve leasing and key issues quickly)  I feel so much better knowing I can reach out to him.  I visited recently and while there could be some improvements in some areas I felt much better and at ease knowing Dan was there to help!  Thank you for doing all you can and fighting for the residents!

google_reviews.author: Samantha Mantey
google_reviews.review: Love living here. Amy is the sweetest most awesome building manager ever. They are incredibly nice and work with you about pets. The buildings are armed so you have to buzz in. The walls are super thick so you almost never hear your side neighbors a little noise from upstairs but thats to be expected. There is a homeless camp behind this building but they keep adding more security to keep us safe which I appreciate. Not to pricey for the size either.

google_reviews.author: purple fear
google_reviews.review:
There is a homeless community right outside the fences of the apartments. They never interfere physically with the activities of those living inside, but nearly EVERY NIGHT, you can hear them arguing, screaming, and sometimes even SHOOTING GUNS while those inside try to live their normal day to day lives. Then, once you get past that, there's the fog, the faulty fire alarms, the dirty and poorly kept stairs and elevators, and a locked "bathroom" that is in the ground floor hallway, for whatever reason. (Even though all of the apartments have actual bathrooms.)

The streets around it are filled with boring malls, a complete lack of sidewalks, and the occasional road kill. At least the food close by is affordable. But even then, it's not worth going out for a walk unless you like forests full of trash. Or boring parking lots. Literally, these apartments are here solely to crash in if you can't afford to live closer to the center of the city.

This part of town probably used to be a beautiful forest a few decades ago, but now it's just the wastebin of snobby capitalists and starving hobos. I would give Tullwood Apartments a 3 normally, but the boring gray shopping "district" and the constant yelling from homeless (including as I write this right now) makes this barely a 2. I'd probably give it a 1.5 if I could. There's literally a car stuffed full of an old homeless ladies' junk in the parking lot, and nobody cares. I am very tired.

google_reviews.author: Aura Leigh
google_reviews.review: Amy the property manager is really nice and seems to genuinely care about the wellbeing of her tenants. I feel safe here which is really important to me. I have plenty of space in my unit; a washer and dryer in an actual laundry room, a large bathroom, etc. Plus it's pet friendly! I like that any store I need is just a couple minute drive. Any complaints I have, don't have anything to do with the unit or the management. Amy is making sure the area is safe and walks the property often, and I appreciate what she does for this place and those who live here.

google_reviews.author: Eric Mike Sloan
google_reviews.review: The newest property manager, Dan Wilson, is getting stuff. We've asked for basic improvements for a few years now. Dan has been knocking them out of the park since he started here a few months back. We finally got carport lights replaced, the front gate gets fixed same day rather than a week later, we gained a handicap access door, and he's taking care of the hallway carpet smell here very soon. Cameras are going up rather than just being talked about. The man is all around improving this place and we appreciate it. Thank you, Dan.

google_reviews.author: Juan Rodriguez
google_reviews.review: I have lived at these apartments for about a year and I have no complaints. The manager (Amy) has always listened to our requests and has gotten our maintenance requests done at a convenient time. She takes care of this place like it is her own. Landscaping is done when it needs to, and makes sure people drive slow and safe in the parking lot. Would recommend to anyone. Rent is very reasonable too.

google_reviews.author: Anthony
google_reviews.review:
Been living here for over 1 year.. parking is great, the property manager is attentive and consistently goes above and beyond what is expected.  The rent is starting to climb closer to my own personal ceiling, but look forward to staying here as long as possible.

Overall, would recommend living here.

Update 1.13.20:. Still here, things are still good.  Amy is still awesome!  Happy 2020.

google_reviews.author: Donna Berger
google_reviews.review: The gated community is nice. The manager is very helpful. But the apartment complex is surrounded by woods that are full of homeless people and is dangerous at times to take your trash out even there is an 6 foot fence with security wire around it.

google_reviews.author: Tara Mallon
google_reviews.review:
We are truly blessed to of found Amy and Tullwood Apts. We lost everything in the floods that hit Sumas in Nov 2021 and I wasnt sure if I would even find a place for my family on such short notice. Thankfully a friend of mine told me about Tullwood so we applied and it couldnt of been more wonderful. We were in our new apartment before Christmas and havent been happier. We know there are elements outside the gate but we are pretty much safe and secure with Amy and the security officers around.
Its a nice location with extremely nice apartments. If your looking for security and comfort this is the place.

Tara C

google_reviews.author: Pat Ryan
google_reviews.review: I enjoy my unit, it's a good size, recently updated, price is fair, and it's pet friendly. Amy is a great property manager who seems to genuinely care about the tenants here. Any complaints I have are of no fault of the management.

google_reviews.author: Eric
google_reviews.review:
update: things seem to have gotten a bit better again. good on the property manager for doing what they can so I added a star.

original: I dont know what changed in the past few months but I really liked it here until other residents started to forget that they live in a community. prepare for loud noises at all times of morning, day or night. cars blast their sound systems, dogs bark uncontrollably inside and outside, upstairs neighbors don't seem to consider those beneath them, people park so crooked no one can park next to them, cars have been left in the back of the lot unmoved and covered in moss for who knows how long so good luck getting a spot some days. there's a homeless camp behind Walmart and you can smell their fires at night which doubles as a safety hazard. recently there's been multiple fights in the parking lot. could benefit from having security around.
I'll change my review if rules are enforced and it's more comfortable again.
on the plus side maintenance is fast, the building is secure, the property manager is nice, and it's away from the main road.

google_reviews.author: Devin Hart
google_reviews.review: My boyfriend and I have been living here for just over 6 months, our first apartment ever, and we love it here! Amy is super awesome and on top of things. She takes the security of the place very seriously which is awesome. Tullwood apartments are awesome highly recommend this place!!

google_reviews.author: Ashley McCarty
google_reviews.review: Loved the apartment that I lived in! Loved the location of the complex. Loved that I had a washer and dryer in my apartment.  Now the manager on the other hand was super nice until she decided to fine me for everything she could possibly think of. I ultimately decided to sign a lease early termination and that's when she really screwed me over by claiming I owe over 10 grand in fees. This to me is outrageous when I lived in the apartment for 9 months and took very good care of it! Also I went without my microwave and one of my toilets for a month or so after putting in a request to have them fixed.

google_reviews.author: Kyria Taylor
google_reviews.review: Such an amazing cozy place to live. Neighbors are all friendly and keep to themselves! I never hear anything above or to the sides of me  Amy the PM is such a sweet heart and has been helpful to my boyfriend and I since day ONE! She just helped us access rental assistance and lifted MONTHS of weight off of our shoulders!

google_reviews.author: kayla coppock
google_reviews.review:
Nice apartments. Neighbors are pretty nice. Very clean property. The manager Amy is great! Met all my needs and overall great attitude throughout the whole process. Shes pretty quick to respond if theres an issue. Best property I've rented from honestly.

Thanks!

google_reviews.author: Isabel Rodriguez
google_reviews.review: I have thoroughly enjoyed and appreciated my time here at the Tullwood apartments. Amy, the manager, is great at communicating with the tenants on expectations for the building and gives ample notice before entering tenants apartments (and for how long). Weve had a very nice time here as her neighbor and tenant, and respect how lovely she keeps the place.

google_reviews.author: Nathan Bradley
google_reviews.review: Tons of homeless and druggies in and out,  gated community is hardly ever really gated as the main entrance is always stuck open.  Parking is a nightmare.  Spaces are so tight and many residents take up 2 spots. Playground is soo old and falling apart very unsafe. Garbage is always over packed and all over the ground. Kids run screaming through the halls slamming the doors to the stairs and leaving trash in the lobby. Hallways and elevator always have a strong odor. My girlfriend recently moved out due to all of these issues. I witnessed all of it when I visited. We do not recommend

google_reviews.author: Jamie Lorden
google_reviews.review: My daughter rents at Tullwood Apts and I have never been happier with a property manager that's on site. Amy has been the most amazing, understanding and kind property manager. She has gone above and beyond for my daughter and grandson from day one! So nice that there are people who care. Thank you Amy!!

google_reviews.author: Derek Boyle
google_reviews.review: Lived there for 2 years and no complaints. Any issues we had, our property manager Amy took care of it diligently and quickly! Move in and move out was easy with no stress. Great location and fair on rent.

google_reviews.author: Tris88
google_reviews.review: We had been displaced due to the flood we got Approved to move in here and then just a week later had severe family problems and couldn't move in. Then a month later we were in desperate need again and I texted Amy. She had saved all my earlier application helped me change all the dates and newly signed and approved we got in within a week. It was a God send. But still not able to recover from the flood financially and my husband losing his job we fell drastically behind on bills. A last ditch effort I tried talking to Amy our landlord for some sort of extention or anything to help us. She was so excited to help get us in touch with the opportunity council to help us with rent and PSE. She worked magic for us in a time we felt all was lost. Thank you Amy for all you have done for our family!!!

google_reviews.author: Cole Miller
google_reviews.review: Amy, the on site manager is, in my opinion a very nice and caring person. Not only does Amy take her job as serious as a surgeon, but she is constantly fighting for the safety and well beings of her tenants. I consider myself very lucky to have found this place.

google_reviews.author: Ning Ma
google_reviews.review:
My husband and I were looking for a temporary lease before our move to Canada and Tullwood Apartments were one of the few places that did month to month leasing so we signed with Amy. Honestly, I never thought I would have such an amazing time here. Amy was so king to us, literally we got free furniture from her, she hooked us up with Internet because she knows a person at Xfinity (we tried another service but they would not give us internet until a week later) but the xfinity guy hooked it up for us the same night because of Amy!!

Amy really does go above and beyond, and if you have questions, she is super responsive! She even gave us the key to our apartment wayyy after office hours around 10pm! That alone saved us a nights cost for a hotel room!

The best part is, its a safe neighborhood, literally 5 mins walk to Walmart and maybe 15 mins walk to restaurants and stores like Best Buy etc. Also, the people here are all families or working professionals. The place is super quiet and no complaints on the noise at all.

google_reviews.author: Crystal Rogers
google_reviews.review: The apartments are well maintained. The property manager Dan was also very helpful when I was having car issues and helped me get a jump on my battery.

google_reviews.author: Natasha Aven
google_reviews.review: I love these apartments. I love that they are fully secured it makes me feel very safe with 2 kids running around. Amy the property manager of fantastic everytime I need something fixed it is done within 48 hours and if I  have a question or concern she is always there to answer it for me weather over email or on person!!

google_reviews.author: Kelly Todd
google_reviews.review: My husband and I love living here! Amy the on-site manager is very professional and respectful, shes always willing to help, she definitely goes the extra mile, weve been here 13 years and dont plan on going anywhere.

google_reviews.author: Dawn Gutierrez
google_reviews.review: These four & five star reviews are because the Property Manager Amy handed out gift cards to Starbucks if they would write a good review!  Not unbelievable if she still works there.....the WORST property manager I've ever encountered AND the common areas are disgustingly filthy!  DO NOT MOVE IN UNLESS YOU'RE DESPERATE

google_reviews.author: Kimberly Slover
google_reviews.review: My family and I have lived here for almost a year now under the new management of Landmark. We moved here from Kennewick, Wa. Since our moving in they have replaced all carpets in the hallway, and rec room and also fresh paint making it look much nicer than when we got here in March. Tullwood is also a very pet friendly place also including designated pet areas which has been a huge improvement. Paul is always really good about resolving any issues you may have and there is a suggestion box if you think of something that would help this place flourish more as an apartment home complex.

google_reviews.author: Melanie Osborn
google_reviews.review: I enjoy it.  There are obviously more fancy apartments to be had, however, this place is affordable and secure.  Management is responsive and kind.   Great location.  I feel at home at Tullwood and really that's all that matters.

google_reviews.author: Barbara Bonstein
google_reviews.review: A few things make this a lower end property, unfinished edges, dips in the creaky floor, dog smell and misfitted toilet seats are a few. Being gated is great but not when the property isn't really worth it.

google_reviews.author: Jamie Lea
google_reviews.review: Disgusting, filthy hallways. Needs painted. Paint is peeling everywhere. No work is done on these apartments to keep them looking decent. Pee stains on carpets in the hallways. Shredded carpet.

google_reviews.author: Christina Rodgers
google_reviews.review: This place is really dirty and in poor condition and the owner is really rude. She once stayed at a hotel I worked at and her room was really dirty there was food and garbage everywhere so I guess it doesn't surprise me at all. There's trash in the hallways and the elevators need serious updating. She also constantly harasses her tenants and makes them feel very uncomfortable. Take your money elsewhere this place is not worth it.

google_reviews.author: Chelsee Autry
google_reviews.review: Amy is an amazing property manager, compassionate and understanding, kind, and helpful. So hard to find a nice place to live these days, Im glad we did!

google_reviews.author: Maegan D
google_reviews.review: Amy is the best landlord Ive ever had she truly cares about her tenants and does whatever she can to help them with almost anything.

google_reviews.author: Rose Mundt
google_reviews.review: well insulated apartments and no noise audible from neighboring apts. Quiet complex. Surrounding trees give a country feel despite being a block + from Walmart  (not visible from apts.) Friendly neighbors and great manager!

google_reviews.author: J
google_reviews.review: Enjoyed our time at the complex. Good management that works with you and responds to calls or text messages. Highly recommend this complex to anyone looking in the Bellingham area.

google_reviews.author: Miss VaSge
google_reviews.review: Great place to live, sense of community and great onsite property manager. Always feel safe here. Pleased to call it home.

google_reviews.author: Jenna Kennedy
google_reviews.review: Not as nice as I expected. The hallways and elevators are dim, musty, and in need of updating. Probably not worth the arm & leg being charged for rent.

google_reviews.author: Elisiah Campbell
google_reviews.review: Surrounded by violent homeless drug addicts. The city doesn't do anything.

google_reviews.author: Michael S
google_reviews.review: Great place to live, safe and secure with great on site management.

google_reviews.author: Kris W
google_reviews.review: Worst apartment complex and property management company known to man.. If you have half a mind, you won't think about living here.

google_reviews.author: Bshk Bob
google_reviews.review: These are apartments that I've been to not bad I guess

google_reviews.author: Timmers Russell
google_reviews.review: Nice apartments and going to be soon a gated community!

google_reviews.author: usethissoftware
google_reviews.review: The management is friendly and cooperative. Just really expensive.

google_reviews.author: Adriana Sabalza
google_reviews.review: Horrible  management and lots of cockroaches

google_reviews.author: Donna Rambis
google_reviews.review: Love it

summary.text:
Good

Tullwood Apartments have garnered quite a few positive remarks from residents, largely due to its spacious and well-constructed living spaces. Residents appreciate the location’s affordability compared to other offerings in the area and highlight the good security measures in place. The sense of community is another plus, with neighbors often described as friendly and cooperative, contributing to a pleasant living environment. Additional benefits noted in user reviews include the pet-friendly nature of the property and its proximity to essential services like Walmart.

The property's management, particularly under Amy, is frequently praised for responsiveness and efficiency in handling maintenance requests, adding to the positive living experience. Many tenants cite Amy’s genuine care for residents' well-being, often noting her efforts to maintain a safe environment. The secure nature of the building, emphasized by thick walls minimizing noise between units, adds to the comfort of the residents. Another management figure, Dan, is also mentioned for his proactive approach in dealing with maintenance issues like carport lights and hallway conditions.

Great

In terms of exceptional experiences, residents frequently highlight the outstanding dedication of the property manager, Amy. Her actions often go above and beyond typical expectations; for instance, she has been commended for her prompt and effective handling of maintenance issues and her personal interest in ensuring tenants’ comfort and safety. Her capabilities in crisis situations, such as assisting displaced residents urgently seeking housing, are seen as life-changing for many.

Moreover, the community atmosphere fostered by management is repeatedly acknowledged by users who feel lucky to have such attentive figures overseeing their residence. The efforts of management have led to many residents experiencing a sense of home and security, with testimonials of management facilitating rental assistance and providing peace of mind for newcomers and ongoing tenants alike. The trust instilled by management’s proactive stance on security and maintenance fosters a highly recommended place to live.

Bad

Despite the positive comments, some reviews indicate issues that affect the overall perception of Tullwood Apartments. One common complaint centers around the surrounding environment. Several residents mention the nearby homeless community, expressing concerns about noise and safety that penetrate the residential enclave. This, unfortunately, diminishes the tranquil atmosphere that the apartment complex tries to maintain.

The condition of common areas, such as hallways and elevators, is another recurring theme in critiques. Complaints regarding cleanliness and maintenance of these spaces suggest that not all aspects of the property meet the high standards set by individual apartments and management. Some residents feel that these areas require more attention to detail, detracting from what otherwise could be a more pleasant living experience.

Ugly

On the extreme end of dissatisfaction, a minority of reviews describe significant issues affecting their quality of life at Tullwood Apartments. These include allegations of poor management practices, such as unjust fines for perceived infractions, and mentions of gifting in exchange for positive reviews. Additionally, reports mention problems with security, citing the malfunctioning of gates and the lack of robust measures against non-resident access to the property.

Some reviews also painfully describe the distress caused by unresolved maintenance issues and the decaying infrastructure of outdoor amenities like playgrounds. The presence of drug activity and other unsavory incidents being observed in the vicinity further compound the grievances of disturbed residents. Several reviews highlight these elements as indicative of what should be urgently addressed to restore confidence in the community's security and living conditions.
